title: Government orders real-time outage reporting after fatal Optus failure | 7NEWS
description: The federal government will order telecommunications companies to report system outages in real-time to customers following the fatal Optus outage that resulted in three deaths earlier this year. Communications Minister Anika Wells is directing ACMA to implement new rules that will impose civil penalties on telcos that fail to notify customers promptly about service disruptions. The Coalition and Greens are pushing for a Senate inquiry into the fatal Optus outage, which they have the numbers to pass without government support. title: Western Sydney airport passes first major test | 7NEWS
description: Western Sydney International Airport conducted its first full-scale emergency drill with a Rural Fire Service 737 air tanker landing at 8.30am, simulating an aircraft in distress scenario involving 300 emergency services staff and 50 vehicles. The milestone test comes just one year before the airport's scheduled opening, marking the end of almost 80 years of discussion about a second airport for Sydney. While the airport predicts it will reach 10 million passengers annually, only QantasLink, Jetstar, Singapore Airlines and Air New Zealand have committed to using the facility so far. title: King Charles heckled over Prince Andrew scandal | 7NEWS
description: King Charles was heckled by a protester demanding answers about Prince Andrew's relationship with Jeffrey Epstein during a public walkabout at a cathedral in England. New reports suggest Prince Andrew may agree to leave his 30-room Royal Lodge mansion in Windsor in exchange for two smaller cottages - Frogmore Cottage for himself and Adelaide Cottage for his ex-wife Sarah Ferguson. British MPs are considering debating Andrew's conduct in Parliament, which could lead to stripping him of his Duke of York title. title: Trump confident of China trade deal with Xi | 7NEWS
description: Donald Trump expresses confidence about reaching a trade agreement with Chinese President Xi Jinping in an upcoming face-to-face meeting during his Asia tour. The anticipated discussion between the world's two largest economies focuses on resolving the ongoing trade and tariff dispute that has unsettled international markets. China is believed to be considering pausing new limits on rare earth minerals as part of potential negotiations. title: Hurricane Melissa threatens Jamaica as strongest storm on record | 7NEWS
description: Hurricane Melissa, a Category 5 storm with winds of 280 kilometres per hour, is approaching Jamaica as the strongest hurricane the nation has seen since records began. The storm has already claimed six lives across the Caribbean and is expected to make landfall within 24 hours, bringing catastrophic flooding, storm surges up to four metres high, and life-threatening conditions. Mandatory evacuation orders have been issued for vulnerable coastal areas, with all flights cancelled and tourists stranded on the island. title: Pauline Hanson drops name from One Nation | 7NEWS
description: Pauline Hanson is dropping her own name from the political party she founded in 1997, rebranding from 'Pauline Hanson's One Nation' to simply 'One Nation'. The Queensland Senator described the change as a defining moment for the movement, putting Australia and Australians first. Primary support for the party has increased to 12 per cent in the latest polling. title: Barnaby Joyce takes a tumble at annual pollies touch football game
description: Nationals MP Barnaby Joyce has taken a tumble the annual pollies vs press touch football game on the Parliament House ovals. The sporting matches are an annual tradition in Canberra.   Joyce has made headlines lately as he is not sitting in the Nationals party room in protest over net zero. He is also considering joining One Nation for a Senate run at the next election. #BarnabyJoyce #politics #auspol #nationals #touchfooty

title: Brain cancer advocates demand urgent government action | 7NEWS
description: Brain cancer patients, carers and advocates gathered at Parliament House demanding urgent government action as a new report reveals the devastating human and economic impact of the disease. Brain cancer is the leading cause of cancer-related deaths in Australians under 40 and the biggest killer of children from any disease, yet remains severely underfunded with survival rates unchanged for 20 years. Advocates are calling for $200 million investment over the next decade to fund clinical trials and specialists, while families continue pushing for Australia's own proton therapy machine despite over $100 million already spent on the still-unavailable equipment. title: Parenting program rewires teenage brains | 7NEWS
description: A University of Melbourne study using MRI scans has shown that a parenting program called 'Tuning Into Teens' can physically rewire adolescent brains. The research tracked 10-12 year old girls before and after their mothers completed the program, revealing changes in brain regions responsible for emotional regulation. The program teaches parents to validate their children's emotions rather than immediately offering reassurance or solutions, allowing teens more time to process their feelings. description: A video chat app that randomly paired children with paedophiles has been removed from Apple and Google app stores following an investigation by the eSafety Commissioner. title: Kidney disease drug Jardiance gets cheaper | 7NEWS
description: The medicine Jardiance will be made cheaper through the Pharmaceutical Benefits Scheme from Saturday for Australians living with chronic kidney disease. The drug works to slow further damage by reducing the amount of sugar and salt absorbed by the organs. Approximately 70,000 Australians with kidney disease will become eligible for this life-changing medication, paying just $25 per month for the tablets. title: Youth wages, AI labelling and Halloween debates | 7NEWS
description: The Debrief panel discusses three current issues: a study showing tens of thousands of young workers could lose jobs if youth award wages are abolished, with 18-year-olds currently earning 70% of adult rates. Australian singer Kate Ceberano calls for clearer labelling of artificial intelligence-created content to ensure transparency about whether songs, books and other media are human or machine-made. A columnist criticises Bunnings for displaying Halloween decorations alongside regular products, questioning when major retailers normalised zombie and skeleton displays. title: Australia's incredible new holiday destinations | 7NEWS
description: Australia offers world-class domestic travel destinations that rival international options, with new attractions including Monarto Safari Resort near Adelaide featuring over 500 animals, Happitat adventure park on the Gold Coast with zip lines and suspension bridges, and a new hotel on Hamilton Island's Cat's Eye Beach. The Back Australia campaign promotes domestic tourism to support local communities and the economy while highlighting the convenience of no jet lag, currency conversion, or expensive airfares. title: Woman arrested after allegedly cutting gas and water supplies at two Sydney hospitals
description: A woman has been arrested after allegedly cutting critical gas and water supplies at two Sydney hospitals. #sydney #hospital #health #crime #arrest
